metadata.synopsis: This pair are a young couple dreaming about their future plans in Baldur's Gate. They're optimistic-- as long as they have each other, they'll make things work. Early/ mid-20s, youthful enthusiasm.

4.speaker: Danis
4.text: I suppose we'll start in the Outer City, get a little business going...
4.context: NodeContext: The excitement of a young couple making plans

25.speaker: Bex
25.text: Your spiced tea is life-changing. And I can bake up almond cakes twenty at a time!
25.context: NodeContext: The excitement of a young couple making plans

96.speaker: Bex
96.text: And we'll have a dog, right?
96.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

37.speaker: Danis
37.text: They don't allow 'em in Baldur's Gate. Cats, though...
37.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

32.speaker: Bex
32.text: A little orange cat! And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.
32.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

92.speaker: Danis
92.text: What'll we name it? I like 'Geoffrey.'
92.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Idle chatter. Have you nothing better to do?
47.context: NodeContext: Won't let the player bring them down. Speaking to githyanki player.

11.speaker: Danis
11.text: No harm in fantasizing about the future. Or don't they do that wherever you're from?
11.context: NodeContext: Won't let the player bring them down. Speaking to githyanki player.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I have but one plan: to earn the favour of my beloved Queen Vlaakith.
20.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of player, playing along because player has started saying weird shit.

84.speaker: Bex
84.text: I'm... sure you'll do just that. Right, Danis?
84.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of player, playing along because player has started saying weird shit.

19.speaker: Danis
19.text: Sure. Yes. Queen Vlaakith and everything.
19.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of player, playing along because player has started saying weird shit.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I aim to purge the parasite infecting my brain.
66.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of player, playing along because player has started saying weird shit.

34.speaker: Bex
34.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of player, playing along because player has started saying weird shit.

26.speaker: Danis
26.text: Rest a bit. We're leaving soon. You'll like Baldur's Gate. It's for all sorts.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: What is this 'cat' you speak of?
2.context: NodeContext: Trying to get player to know what she means by 'cat'. Playful.

63.speaker: Bex
63.text: Small. Whiskers. 'Meow meow'. You know. Cat.
63.context: NodeContext: Trying to get player to know what she means by 'cat'. Playful.

70.speaker: Player
70.context: NodeContext: Realizing player is a total weirdo, trying to get away.

87.speaker: Bex
87.text: Right. Erm. Danis, we've got to do the thing... in the place... over there. Remember?
87.context: NodeContext: Realizing player is a total weirdo, trying to get away.

78.speaker: Danis
78.context: NodeContext: Playing along with Bex to escape weird player.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: What use do you have of this creature?
33.context: NodeContext: Spoken like a cat lover.

95.speaker: Bex
95.text: Well, they're excellent mousers. And their little faces are so cute!
95.context: NodeContext: Spoken like a cat lover.

24.speaker: Danis
24.text: Where are you from where there are no cats, by the by?
24.context: NodeContext: Deep curiosity about the player, still friendly but a tinge of suspicion

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I hail from another plane. Is that not obvious?
93.context: NodeContext: Thinks player is very strange, but still friendly

36.speaker: Danis
36.text: Hm. Right. Well, welcome to the Sword Coast.
36.context: NodeContext: Thinks player is very strange, but still friendly

76.speaker: Bex
76.text: Come with us to Baldur's Gate. If cats are new to you, you won't believe what you'll find there.
76.context: NodeContext: Thinks player is very strange, but still friendly

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I am from a land far from here.
29.context: NodeContext: Thinks player is very strange, but still friendly

81.speaker: Danis
81.text: I figured. But no matter. We're going to make ourselves a new home in Baldur's Gate. You can too.
81.context: NodeContext: Thinks player is very strange, but still friendly

86.speaker: Bex
86.text: Travel with us, if you like. Maybe we can show you to squirrels and ducks on the way.

88.speaker: Player
88.context: NodeContext: HAs been rebuffed by player. No real interest in player anymore.

45.speaker: Danis
45.context: NodeContext: HAs been rebuffed by player. No real interest in player anymore.

85.speaker: Danis
85.text: Where were we, love? A cat and a house with a porch...
85.context: NodeContext: Ignoring player now, talkign to Danis again cause player is a weirdo.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Are you attracted to these... cats?
61.context: NodeContext: Shocked, player just implied she's attracted to cats. Not upset, just really surprised.

5.speaker: Bex
5.context: NodeContext: Shocked, player just implied she's attracted to cats. Not upset, just really surprised.

71.speaker: Bex
71.text: Look - whoever you are, whatever you're into, you'll find it in Baldur's Gate. I only have eyes for this one here.
71.context: NodeContext: Defending herself against players accusation of being into cats.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Ah, yes - I know the beasts. Insufficiently meaty.

49.speaker: Danis
49.text: Oh really? What do you suggest then?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: It is a beast of burden. It requires no name.

56.speaker: Danis
56.text: Beast of burden? It's a kitty-cat, not a rothé.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: A powerful githyanki name should suffice: 'Krak'jthak'.

31.speaker: Danis
31.text: 'Crack-what'? Gone gods, It's just a kitty-cat.

72.speaker: Bex
72.text: 'Geoffrey' is great. Let's go with that.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I couldn't say. Only varsh name githyanki young.

21.speaker: Danis
21.text: Let's start with one and see how it goes.

50.speaker: Danis
50.text: ... and a high fence to keep eavesdroppers out.
50.context:
NodeContext: Just now noticing the player. Following Bex's line: 'And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.' A little wary but not too bad
-- who is this perosn who's approached them?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Don't mind me. I was just passing through.
69.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

10.speaker: Danis
10.text: No bother. We're just daydreaming, anyhow.
10.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

68.speaker: Bex
68.text: What about you? Big plans for when you get to the city?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I want a new life, entirely. To be a wholly new person.
73.context: NodeContext: Contemplating a pint and a clean room. Sounds luxurious!

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I'm worried the Baldurians are going to rob me for all I'm worth. I'm quite clueless.
42.context: NodeContext: Contemplating a pint and a clean room. Sounds luxurious!

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Knowing me, there is a high chance I will start a fire and be sent to jail.
75.context: NodeContext: Contemplating a pint and a clean room. Sounds luxurious!

38.speaker: Player
38.text: A pint and a clean room would do me a world of good.
38.context: NodeContext: Contemplating a pint and a clean room. Sounds luxurious!

16.speaker: Danis
16.context: NodeContext: Contemplating a pint and a clean room. Sounds luxurious!

79.speaker: Bex
79.text: Won't be long now. One more trip, then we can really rest.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Plans? Just surviving the journey is ambitious enough already.
7.context: NodeContext: Looking on the bright side

35.speaker: Danis
35.text: Luck's been on our side this far. No reason to think it'll run out now.
35.context: NodeContext: Looking on the bright side

28.speaker: Bex
28.text: Optimism, my friend. Try it out.

52.speaker: Danis
52.text: Oh. That's too bad. I'd heard you were good in a fight.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I'll be keeping to myself. People tend to stare at me.
58.context: NodeContext: Positive again, won't let the player bring them down.

90.speaker: Danis
90.text: But... I've heard there's all sorts in the city. It might not be like it was in Elturel. I mean - in Baldur's Gate, they give you a chance.

27.speaker: Bex
27.text: Good luck to you. Wish us a little too. I think we'll all need it.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *Surely destined for the slaughter. What would be more perfect than to die by your love's side, and know love was not enough?*

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I've never been to Baldur's Gate before. Perhaps I can drop in on you.
77.context: NodeContext: Positive again, won't let the player bring them down.

17.speaker: Danis
17.text: May your ale be dark, and the loving sweet!
17.context: NodeContext: Positive again, won't let the player bring them down.

1.speaker: Bex
1.text: Good luck to you, then. And wish us some too!
1.context: NodeContext: Positive again, won't let the player bring them down.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: It's The Blushing Mermaid for me. Bit rough, but the ale's cheap.
40.context: NodeContext: Lightly feigned politeness, like refusing a yucky dish.

94.speaker: Danis
94.text: We've had enough rough to last us a good long while.
94.context: NodeContext: Lightly feigned politeness, like refusing a yucky dish.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'll be seeking the warmth of the Elfsong Tavern.

41.speaker: Bex
41.text: I think I've heard of that place. Something about a stuffed dragon's head in one of the dining rooms...

65.speaker: Bex
65.text: It's settled, Danis. You, me, and the Elfsong Tavern, first thing when we arrive.

23.speaker: Bex
23.text: If we see you there, we'll get you a pint. For your finder's fee.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Sorry, didn't mean to interrupt. Good luck to you both.
9.context: NodeContext: Gentle enthusiasm. Slight caution in voice, but still positive.

8.speaker: Danis
8.text: Thanks. I suppose we'll all need it.
8.context: NodeContext: Gentle enthusiasm. Slight caution in voice, but still positive.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Two tiefling refugees? You'll be lucky to get a square of dirt at a public house.
14.context: NodeContext: Player tried to bring them down, but Danis and Bex are having none of it.

13.speaker: Danis
13.text: If that's what we're offered, we'll take it. Everyone's got to start somewhere.
13.context: NodeContext: Player tried to bring them down, but Danis and Bex are having none of it.
